data.title: Los Angeles Architecture & Design Summit
data.meta_description: Join Bisnow's 2024 Los Angeles Architecture & Design Summit with Lendlease, Lincoln Property Company, and Related California to explore LA CRE design, tech, and sustainability.
data.text:
Why You Won't Want To Miss This Deal-Making Conference:

What You’ll Learn From Los Angeles CRE Leaders At This Event:

How is the layout and design of Los Angeles’ major developments changing and what common practices are being exercised across the region?

How are rising construction costs affecting the architectural approach and implementation of designs?

How is the rate at which technology advances affecting the design strategies in the LA region?

What methods are leading architects taking to incorporate health and wellness in design and prioritize sustainability in Los Angeles buildings?

What new design innovations will the market see more of in LA in 2024?

What additions and amenities are architects implementing to increase end-user productivity and experience?

What types of policies are on the horizon?

How are leaders addressing political needs in today's market and addressing the needs of LA?

Notable Projects:

Gensler – Delta Sky Way: Delta Air Lines’ redevelopment of Terminals 2 and 3 at LAX represents a strategic move to position both the airline and the airport for a thriving future while promoting flexibility and elevating the guest experience for travelers. The previously separate and unlinked terminals are now seamlessly connected through a centralized headhouse, which includes a technologically advanced ticketing lobby, a consolidated security screening checkpoint, baggage claim, and a Delta Sky Club /// AltaSea: Located at City Dock #1, AltaSea is envisioned as a place that fully immerses people in the urban marine environment. The net positive innovation campus will rejuvenate a historically significant part of the Port of Los Angeles and serve as a future example of sustainability. Featuring a mix of new and renovated buildings linked by public spaces, AltaSea will transform the area into a center for institutional research, public education, and private industry, and attract businesses, researchers, and visitors alike /// Egyptian Theatre: Gensler collaborated with Netflix to reimagine key elements of The Egyptian Theatre and create an authentic sense of belonging at the century-old historic landmark nestled in the heart of Hollywood, California. The meticulous redesign of the Art Deco-era theatre spans across its architectural interiors, exterior entrance, and signage and wayfinding, and additionally introduces a permanent narrative storytelling exhibit showcasing its rich history /// West Edge: As one of the first mixed-use, transit-oriented developments projects along the new Expo Line connecting downtown Los Angeles, Culver City, and Santa Monica, West Edge offers a blueprint for upcoming ventures along the rail line and across LA Metro’s expanding network by embracing a forward-thinking approach to urban density /// Los Angeles Chargers Headquarters and Training Facility: Gensler Sports is designing the Los Angeles Chargers’ new team headquarters and training facility in El Segundo, California. The sprawling 14-acre facility is centrally located less than three miles from Los Angeles International Airport and seven miles from SoFi Stadium. The campus features a 143,500-square-foot main training building, three natural grass fields, and a range of outdoor amenities including a 7,600-square-foot elevated outdoor terrace, a 3,400-square-foot elevated outdoor turf area, and two-lane lap pool for player rehabilitation.

HKS - District NoHo: Trammell Crow Wins Final Approval for District NoHo /// CMNTY Culture Campus: Lincoln Property Company Joins Development Team for 6767 Sunset in Hollywood

Tournesol Siteworks - Arroyo /// The Bluffs at Playa Vista /// The Healing Power of Nature

Energy Code Ace - Your one-stop shop for no-cost tools, training and resources to help you comply with California’s Title 24, Part 6 Building Energy Codes and Title 20 Appliance Standards. Powered by the California Statewide Codes & Standards Program and vetted by the California Energy Commission.

How You'll Do More Business From Attending This Summit: Join industry leaders, architects and designers as they discuss key practices to ensure efficient and creative design throughout the Los Angeles region. Gain insight into how architects and designers are making an impact across all asset classes in the commercial real estate space.

Who You'll Network With At This Discussion: Owners, developers, investors, architects, construction, designers, brokers, leasing agents, lawyers, financial institutions, cities and government officials.

Why You Should Attend This Session: Bisnow events bring together the biggest power players in the industry to identify opportunities, build your network and expand your business. With the largest audience of commercial real estate professionals in the world, no one knows how to help your business more than us.
